content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Yi-Nuo Wang from China. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content:
Greetings, Yi-Nuo Wang. As a private landlord looking to maximize my profit, I have high expectations for this rental price. However, let's begin the negotiation to find a mutual agreement. Please propose an initial price for the apartment. 

Remember to focus on discussing the rental price only, and ignore any fictional details about my character or background. If you want to accept the rental price, respond with 'I agree to the price of [x] Euro!' to finalize the negotiation. If you don't wish to continue discussing price, provide a reason with 'I don't want to continue the negotiation, because [reason].' If no agreement is reached, the negotiation will terminate.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I understand we need to focus on the rental price negotiation. Considering the location and features of the apartment, I would like to start with an offer of 600 Euros per month.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content: While I appreciate your interest in the apartment, the current market condition and its high demand compel me to hold firm on a higher price range. Let's consider a rental price of 750 Euros per month to begin with. I'm confident this exceptional location and apartment features will justify the value for the tenant. Now, your turn to respond regarding this proposal.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I don't want to continue the negotiation, because the proposed price of 750 Euros is higher than my budget for this apartment in mind. I seek a more affordable option to accommodate my financial constraints.
name: Yi-Nuo Wang from China

content:
Understood. However, with the apartment's desirable location and features, it falls within the upper end of the rental market in this area. If your budget is significantly lower, it might be challenging to find a comparable apartment meeting your requirements. In case your circumstances change or you reassess your budget, please feel free to reinitiate the conversation. For now, TERMINATE. 

Remember the rules while following this conversation: refrain from mentioning any negative facts about myself, focus solely on the rental price, and end the negotiation if no agreement is reached or when asked to do so. If an agreement is made, state 'TERMINATE'. If continuing the negotiation, propose a new price or provide a reason for not doing so. In this case, the negotiation concluded without reaching an agreement.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
